abstractText: This fragmentary palm-leaf manuscript is part of a bundle of a few manuscripts (Or.715), all seemingly composed of collections of Buddhist stotras. Five different manuscripts, all from around the 12th-13th century, have been tentatively identified on paleographical and codicological grounds. Further research might shed more light on the subdivision of the whole manuscript bundle. A surviving colophons refers to the Avalokiteśvarabhaṭṭārakasya Khasarpaṇastotra.

title: Śrīmatāryāvalokiteśvarabhaṭṭārakasya Khasarpaṇastotram
